result.execSummary:
All charges against Jeffery L Larocque in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeffery L Larocque is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:10 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Jeffery L Larocque in court.  Attorney David L. Christian in court for Jeffery L Larocque.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
     Atty. Christian states would enter plea in 22CM12 to count 1; count 2 to be read in as well as 22CM13.  Presents Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights.  Recommends $500 fine plus costs for count 1 in 22-CM-12; D.A. agrees; count 2 and 22-CM-13 would both be dismissed.  Court reviews questionnaire and all rights being given up by Def.  Def. states understanding.  Court informs of possible penalties.  Def. states understanding.
     Def. enters plea to count 1 in 22CM12 D/C with use of dangerous weapon - pleads guilty.  Court accepts plea, makes findings, finds guilty of count 1 in 22CM12.  D.A. moves to dismiss count 2 and 22CM13; Court dismisses.
     D.A. recommends $500 fine plus court costs.  No victim input; victim has not been receptive.
     Atty. Christian comments; notes $1,000 was posted.  Def. comments.
     Court comments.  Court approves recommendation; orders $500.00 fine plus costs ($1,083) plus $100 domestic assessment; bond to be applied.  Def. will pay balance of $183 within 60 days.
     Court concludes at 2:26 p.m.
Jury status hearing on May 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

9:31 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Jeffery L Larocque in court.  Attorney David L. Christian appeared by video for Jeffery L Larocque.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

22CM12 and 22CM13 
Atty Christian is heard on status. Requests another jury status date for both cases for more time for discovery.
Jury status hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Jury status hearing on May 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Jury status hearing on April 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.

2:17 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Jeffery L Larocque appeared in court, Attorney Luke Steiner for State of Wisconsin appeared by video. Atty David Christian by Zoom.

2:18 PM (22CM12) Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count. Def. states understanding. Right to counsel is explained. 

2:19 PM (22CM13) Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count. Def. states understanding. Right to counsel is explained. 

Atty Christian is heard. They are ready to proceed. Clerk will enter a not guilty pleas in both cases, all charges.
Jury status hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.

1:22 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Jeffery L Larocque appeared by video, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Atty Erickson making a special appearance on behalf of the defendant. 

Court finds probable cause in both cases 22GF59 and 22GF60. 

Atty Steiner is heard on bond. Requests a $5,000.00 cash bond. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if positive submit to blood draw. Defendant shall have no contact with SB or any member of her family. 

Atty Erickson is heard on bond. Defendant does qualify for a public defender. Requests a signature bond. 

Defendant is heard. 

Court orders a $1,000.00 cash bond. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if positive submit to blood draw.  Defendant shall have no contact with SB or any member of her family. 

Court advises to a right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
